item.title: ARC Raiders Soared in Sales After Just Two Days on the Market, Data Reveals
item.content:encoded:
In a fresh report from NewZoo, it has been confirmed that ARC Raiders skyrocketed within just two days on the market, beating many of the worldâ€™s most capable and impactful games in Octoberâ€™s revenue charts. The data revealed that ARC Raiders secured the seventh spot in the charts in October, despite being released on October 30.

ARC Raiders has proven to be one of the most transformative games ever released, taking over the extraction shooter genre and retaining an enormous player base almost a month after release.

ARC Raiders On Top (Almost)

In an all-new October revenue report from NewZoo, it was documented that ARC Raiders hit the seventh spot in the charts despite being on the shelves for just two days in October.

It effortlessly walked over some of the biggest games in the business:

  • Counter-Strike 2
  • Call of Duty
  • Minecraft
  • VALORANT
  • ROBLOX
  • World of Warcraft
  • Marvel Rivals

The stunning achievement sat ARC Raiders behind the likes of NBA 2K26, Fortnite, Ghost of Yotei, and Battlefield 6, all of which is/were to be expected.

ARC Raiders continues to stun gamers worldwide, and everyone from diehard extraction shooter fans to those totally new to the concept is getting on board. Recently, a streamer-backed initiative saw some of the biggest creators in the space take part in an unofficial â€˜warâ€™ that pulled unprecedented audiences into some streamersâ€™ chats.

Thereâ€™s a hefty roadmap in store for ARC Raiders, and Embark Studios, the gameâ€™s stellar creator, has vowed to support the title for years to come. The next major update will be Cold Snap, coming in December 2025.

Have you started playing ARC Raiders yet? Let us all know what you think about it on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Udo Kier has sadly passed away

item.title: "He was truly an 'icon' of his time" - Hideo Kojima pays tribute to OD actor Udo Kier, who has passed away
item.content:encoded:
Veteran actor Udo Kier has passed away. He was 81.

Kier was born Udo Kierspe in Cologne, Germany. When he was 18, he moved to London, before going on to star in films including Ace Ventura: Pet Detective, Armageddon and Blade.

The news of his passing was shared by his partner, artist Delbert McBride. Along with his film credits, Kier also starred in a number of games, including as Yuri in the Command and Conquer: Red Alert series. The actor was also due to star in Hideo Kojima's Xbox horror game OD.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

Reflecting on Kier's passing, Kojima said he was "at a loss for words".

"It all happened far too suddenly," Kojima wrote on social media. "Because of the strike, we weren't able to shoot 'OD' for a long time, and we were forced to reschedule to next year. Even during that time, Udo and I exchanged emails frequently. We stayed in close contact. When we met in Milan at the end of September, he told me how much he was looking forward to the shoot starting up again next year. He was full of energy then too, making me laugh with his usual 'Udo-isms'.

"I still can't believe this.

"Udo wasn't just an actor. He was truly an 'icon' of his time. We've lost a great 'icon'. There will never be another like him.

"Udo, rest in peace. I will never forget you."

Along with Kier, Sophia Lillis, Hunter Schafer and director Jordan Peele - who is known for his films Get Out and Nope - are also connected to Kojima's OD. At the time of writing, it's unknown if Kier will be recast or if his role will be removed from the project.

Rest in peace, Udo, and thank you for all you've done.

Related topics

item.title: FEROCIOUS Is an Indie Single Player FPS Where You Fight Dinosaurs But Also Control Them, And Itâ€™s Out on December 4
item.content:encoded:
Publisher tinyBuild has announced that the indie single player first-person shooter game FEROCIOUS will be released on December 4 for PC via Steam.

FEROCIOUS, powered by Unity, is the debut game of OMYOG, a small studio that features the expertise of both AAA game and film veterans. Leonard Saalfrank, inspired by King Kong, leads the vision, while Mark, ex-Far Cry and Battlefront II director, brings sandbox-level design expertise. Writers like JÃ¶rg Ihle and Dominik Hochwald add narrative depth from film, games, and theme parks.

In FEROCIOUS, players will find themselves stranded on a dangerous island and forced to survive against mercenaries, dinosaurs, and a vibrant yet hostile ecosystem. At every turn, they must face challenges in the form of savage predators, treacherous terrain, and limited resources. Careful exploration is vital to uncover hidden paths, secrets and essential gear. Furthermore, as shown in the release date trailer (embedded below), there's a twist in that a so-called 'dino control device' lets you turn the dinosaurs to your side, so that they might be used to attack enemies, open paths, or infiltrate guarded areas.

The lore explanation is that it scans the creature's brain and reproduces its vocal signals, not unlike what was shown in Jurassic Park 3, but with the usage of ultrasonic calls that only the lizards can hear. Once scanned, the player can get a dinosaur to follow them, move to a particular spot, attack a target, break obstacles, or even fetch items. The commands depend on the species; some are more obedient (or smarter) than others. Not every dinosaur in the game will be controllable, though.

TinyBuild did not share the pricing yet, but given that it's an indie game, we expect it to be priced accordingly. The Steam page also includes the minimum and recommended PC system requirements for FEROCIOUS, by the way.

Minimum:
Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
OS: Windows 10/11 64-bit
Processor: Intel Core i5 4th Gen or AMD equivalent
Memory: 12 GB RAM
Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 1060 / AMD RX 580
DirectX: Version 11
Storage: 25 GB available space

Recommended:
Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
OS: Windows 10/11 64-bit
Processor: Intel Core i7 or Ryzen 5 3600 and up
Memory: 16 GB RAM
Graphics: NVIDIA RTX 2060 / AMD RX 5600
DirectX: Version 11
Storage: 25 GB available space

item.title: This week in PC games: warriors, painters, roguelikes, sailors, shotguns, subs and metroidvanias
item.content:encoded:
What we're feeding the Maw

November is... merry! As the great grim centipede of people and property that is Videogaming continues its progress of the midnight wood, a dozen auteur designers from theatre backgrounds don coxcomb hats and sequined codpieces. They climb onto carts and stage a chariot race, beating each other with bladders decorated to look like Roger Ebert. There is laughter up and down the train. Meanwhile, the industry seers and marketing-mancers have received hopeful tidings from their friends among the owls and bats. The trees are thinning out ahead. The stars can sometimes be seen. There is wild talk that third-person cover shooters are about to come back into fashion.

That isn't all the owls and bats have seen, however. As the path curves, we find ourselves in the courtyard of a squat and forbidding tower. Five levels of blood-flecked obsidian and pixelated braziers, each named for a day of the week, each infested by perfectly terrifying new PC games. Never mind that the edifice has clearly been slapped together using assets lifted from a webinar. Never mind that you can see fuchsia checkerboards everywhere. The tower's frightful denizens must be defeated - or possibly even bought - if the convoy is to proceed.

Monday 24th November

  • Nientum - Op.ZERO (early access) is a mix of 2D platforming and rhythm-action in which amnesiac anime girls restore a creepy theatre and perform twisted versions of familiar musicals.
  • On a similar theme, here's Constance, a 2D metroidvania about a somersaulting painter who is navigating worlds derived form her mental health difficulties. Your paintbrush is at least as mighty as a sword, but watch out, using its magical abilities will corrupt you.
  • Primal Fray is a turn-based, creature-collecting strategy roguelike set on floating hexagonal islands. Try to make your enemies fall off first.

Tuesday 25th November

  • In A.I.L.A you are a games tester contending with a villainous AI level designer (think Portal, not ChatGPT), rather than the more familiar problems of precarity and crunch.
  • In Newgroundsy cartoon FPS Captain Wayne - Vacation Desperation (pictured), you are a sailor with a shotgun fist on a mission "to rob the rich to feed the badass". I hear and salute the praxis of the implication that one cannot be both rich and badass.
  • In Red Rogue Sea you are playing FTL, but with pirate galleons and turn-based combat and deck-building. Not that much like FTL, perhaps.

Wednesday 26th November

  • A dragon has turned the world to night and it's your job to settle his hash in Holder Of Place, an autobattling roguelite deckbuilder.

Thursday 27th November

  • Kings Of Hell (early access) is a palpably Power-Stoned 2000s-style beat 'em up starring upwardly mobile demons.
  • Veterum is a turn-based fantasy strategy-me-do with an emphasis on shaping battlefields in your favour.

Friday 28th November

  • Death In Abyss is a 3D underwater "flight" combat game in which you play a nimble submersible with fins fighting off huge, fleshy leviathans. Chorus meets Devil Daggers, maybe?
  • Ayasa: Shadows Of Silence is a Little Nightmarish jaunt through six platforming worlds dedicated to Faith, Hope, Love, Greed, Indifference, and Betrayal. I get the sense that even the nice-sounding worlds will be dreadful.

The tower is soon afire, for in these strange and glitchy times even obsidian may burn. Our gimlet-eyed QA staff chase the surviving games into the woods; they will haunt us for months to come, stealthily adding themselves to our wishlists while we huddle in our wagons, blowing into frosty fingers and dreaming of the brighter tomorrow promised by the soothsayers. Perhaps the Second Coming is at hand! Perhaps another 2.0 update is at hand!



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/this-week-in-pc-games-warriors-painters-roguelikes-sailors-shotguns-subs-and-metroidvanias

item.title: Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds Gets Its First Big Discount For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

2025 has seen a surprising number of fun arcade racing games, including the recent Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds, which landed on PS5, Xbox Series X, Nintendo Switch, and PC back in September. And for a limited time during Black Friday, you can get the Amazon Exclusive Edition for just $45 (was $60). That's the lowest price we've seen since launch, and it applies to PS5, Xbox Series X, and Switch versions of the game. This deal will only stick around during Black Friday, however, and because it's the first real discount we've seen for the game, it's a good idea to pick it up now if it's on your wishlist.

Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds - Amazon Exclusive Edition

$45 (was $70)

Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds features 24 tracks, 23 playable characters, and 45 customizable vehicles to try out. The roster features familiar faces from previous Sonic the Hedgehog games, as well as guest racers from other franchises like Mega Man, SpongeBob, Like A Dragon, Persona, Minecraft, and more. The game features full single-player modes, local split-screen support, and online modes for up to 12 players.

The Sonic Racing: CrossWorld Amazon Exclusive Edition includes the full base game on your platform of choice, plus an exclusive fold-out poster featuring Sonic, Tails, Shadow, Knuckles, and other familiar faces as they cruise through a variety of worlds.

Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds - Amazon Exclusive Edition Black Friday Deal

  • PS5 -- $45 ($70)

This isn't the only great Sonic deal running during Black Friday. A bunch of games are available for $20 or less on PS5 and Xbox (or $25 on Switch), including Sonic Frontiers (normally $50), Sonic Origins Plus (normally $40), and Sonic Superstars (normally $30). The last two get you fairly traditional 2D platforming action, while Frontiers is a whole new 3D adventure that lets you explore a sprawling open world. Sonic X Shadow Generations is also discounted to $25 (was $50) on Switch, Switch 2, PS5, and Xbox. This recently released collection includes two games in one package: a remaster of 2011's Sonic Generations alongside the all-new Shadow Generations. And for more racing fun, you can pick up the Sonic Mania + Team Sonic Racing Double Pack on Switch for just $25 (was $40). Along with the kart racer, Sonic Mania gets you both new zones to explore and old favorites from Sonic 1, 2, 3, and Sonic & Knuckles. Check out all the Black Friday deals on Sonic video games below.

item.title: Persona 3 Reload Switch 2 Edition Is Down To $40 For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you've picked up a Switch 2 console recently and you're looking to grab a game that'll keep you entertained for nearly 100 hours, Persona 3 Reload comes highly recommended, and it's on sale at Amazon for $40 (was $60) thanks to the retailer's Black Friday event. If you don't own a Switch 2, you can also grab the game on PS5, PS4, and Xbox Series X, but like many of the other video game deals in Amazon's event, these Persona 3 Reload discounts could run out fast, so don't wait--it could be Dark Hour on these deals before you know it.

Persona 3 Reload (Switch 2)

$40 (was $60)

Persona 3 Reload is a full-scale remake of the 2006 classic, introducing new characters, expanded storylines, an all-new voice cast, and a re-recorded soundtrack. The game also features quality-of-life improvements and a redesigned interface that refines the experience while preserving the heart of the cult-classic PS2 original.

Note that the Switch 2 version of the game comes on a Game Key-Card, which means none of the game data is included on the cart. Instead, inserting the physical game into your system unlocks the digital version, which you must download to your console before you can start playing. Expect Persona 3 Reload to take up about 25GB on your Switch 2's internal storage or SD card. It's also worth pointing out is that the Episode Aigis DLC expansion is available a separate $35 purchase on the Switch 2 eShop. Episode Aegis adds roughly 30 hours of new story content that takes place after the base game's ending, along with new costumes and music.

While Persona 3 Reload came to Switch 2 just a few months ago, it originally launched on PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, and PC back in early 2024. The physical PlayStation and Xbox versions also happen to be on sale at Amazon, and at much lower prices than the Switch 2 version. You can check out all the Persona 3 Reload Black Friday deals below.

All Persona 3 Reload Black Friday Deals

  • Switch 2 -- $40 ($60)
  • PS5 -- $18 ($70)
  • PS4 -- $20 ($70)
  • Xbox Series X -- $25 ($35.16)

Persona 3 Reload is just one of several Atlus-published RPGs on sale at Amazon during Black Friday. You can also grab Persona 5 Royal on Switch, Metaphor ReFantazio, Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance Edition, and the recently released Raidou Remastered: the Mystery of the Soulless Army. Check out all the Atlus RPG deals at Amazon. item.title: Invincible VS Data Mine Reveals Unannounced Controversial Character
item.content:encoded:
According to a data mine from the Invincible VS Closed Alpha, a controversial character is set to join the roster. Furthermore, it seems the character may be the next one announced.

Based on the comic series and animated show, Invincible is a more bloody version of superheroes. Think The Boys, but more on the mature and dramatic side. The Prime Video show has been going strong for three seasons, with the fourth coming in March 2026. Many game adaptations have been made, but Invincible VS gives the fans what theyâ€™ve wanted: a good old-fashioned fighting game.

Announced earlier this year, the game, which comes from former Killer Instinct developers, looks to be the ultimate Invincible experience, down to the showâ€™s all-star cast (like The Walking Deadâ€™s Steven Yeun and Whiplashâ€™s JK Simmons) returning. Now, it seems a new character has been prematurely revealed, and itâ€™s one that comic book fans will be taken aback by.

Data Mine for Invincible VS Closed Alpha Reveals Anissa as Playable Fighter

The news comes from Reddit user RIPMrMufasi, who posted on /GamingLeaksandRumours about the Invincible VS Closed Alpha. The test, which started on November 21st, has been going fairly well. As was the case with Marvel Cosmic Invasion, it doesnâ€™t stop fans from doing a data mine into the files and seeing if anything unannounced is in it. As expected, there was indeed something: a character available through a model swap bug, seen in the video here.

According to the video from the Invincible VS data mine, the character looks to be Anissa. In the show, the Viltrumite warrior is played by Shantel VanSanten (One Tree Hill, The Boys). The character, seen as an antagonist in the show, is a rather controversial choice. While not adapted into the show yet, an inappropriate moment in the comics between her and Mark, the protagonist, has made many worried about her inclusion.

As of now, the character has not been confirmed by Skybound Games or Quarter Up, so take it with a grain of salt. For fans of the show, the character is a welcome addition to the roster. However, to fans of the comics, itâ€™s one that may stir up some controversy. Either way, if true, it wonâ€™t be long until itâ€™s official.

What do you think of Anissa possibly being added to Invincible VSâ€™ roster? Think itâ€™s a controversial pick? Will it become a problem soon? Which Invincible character would you like to see in the game? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more fighting games, check out our articles on Marvel Tokon: Fighting Soulsâ€™ upcoming beta and Avatar Legends: The Fighting Game. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: Call of Duty, OD Actor, Udo Kier, Has Passed Away
item.content:encoded:
Udo Kier, one of the stars in Kojima Productionsâ€™ upcoming OD, has passed away. The German actor, 81, had starred in many films and shows, as well as Call of Duty: WWII.

According to Variety, the actorâ€™s partner, Delbert McBride, confirmed the news to Variety. He passed away on Sunday morning. As of writing, there has been no comment in regards to the cause of death.

Udo Kier, A Legend On and Off Camera

Udo Kier has starred in well over 200 films, starting in 1966 on the TV show Road to Saint Tropez. His frequent collaborations with iconic artist Andy Warhol and the vampire film genre made him a familiar face for fans. In the 90s, Kier appeared in films like Ace Ventura: Pet Detective, Blade, and Johnny Mnemonic. 

Heâ€™s appeared in several video game adaptations like Far Cry and BloodRayne. However, heâ€™s also shown up in games over the span of his career. Often military, Udo Kier played the role of Yuri in Command & Conquer: Red Alert 2 and Yuriâ€™s Revenge. Furthermore, he played Dr. Peter Staub in Call of Duty: WWII and Erich in Martha is Dead. 

One of the actorâ€™s future projects is OD, Hideo Kojimaâ€™s next big horror project for Kojima Productions. Unfortunately, it seems Udo Kier did not finish filming for the project, as Kojima tweeted about his passing, saying filming was set to start next Spring. The actor was announced alongside Hunter Schafer and Sophia Lillis at the 2023 Game Awards. A teaser for the Xbox Game Studiosâ€™ title was revealed earlier this year. Itâ€™s unknown if the actor will be recast or scrapped from the project at this time.

Our thoughts go out to his family and his partner during this difficult time.

Whatâ€™s your favorite Udo Kier performance? Have you played a game heâ€™s been in? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Meta AI-Powered Ray-Ban Sunglasses Are On Sale For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you've ever wished your sunglasses could play music, take photos, or even answer questions for you, then you're in luck. Select Ray-Ban Meta AI Glasses models are seeing generous discounts for Black Friday 2025. These are all Gen 1 models--so they won't have the extended battery life or upgraded cameras of the Gen 2 models--but they still offer many of the same features as the newer models, including Meta AI support, built-in speakers and camera, and more. While the smart glasses are available in a variety of frames and lens styles, it looks like only the Wayfarer frames are currently getting discounts. You can snag a pair for as low as $239.20 (normally $299) thanks to Amazon's sale.

Ray-Ban X Meta Smart Glasses - Wayfarer Frames (Gen 1)

Starts at $239

If you're unfamiliar with Meta's collaboration with Ray-Ban, these smart glasses aren't your average pair of frames. Inside its larger arms, you'll find heaps of cool tech that lets you ask Meta AI questions, take photos or videos, or listen to music. You can even ask Meta AI what you're looking at, making the smart glasses a helpful travel companion. The frames are only slightly thicker than those of some typical glasses, so unless someone is looking closely, most won't even realize you have a computer sitting on your head.

As for the actual specs, you'll find an ultra-wide 12MP camera, a five-mic system for easy voice recognition, an included charging and travel case, and a built-in button to activate its AI. Any images or footage you capture can also be easily shared on Facebook or Instagram.

While these AI-powered smart glasses are stylish, they're much simpler compared to AR and VR devices. Those who are interested in something more powerful should also check out Amazon's limited-time Black Friday deals on the Meta Quest 3S VR headset. Amazon has two deals available--the first drops the Mea Quest 3S 128GB model to just $250 (was $300) and includes a $50 Amazon gift card as a free bonus. You can also score the Meta Quest 3S bundle that includes the 256GB model of the headset with a copy of Batman: Arkham Shadow and a $49 Amazon Gift Card for just $329 (was $400). These deals are exclusive to Amazon and won't stick around long, so grab them while you can.

Meta Quest 3S VR Headset Black Friday Deals

The Quest 3S is much bigger than the Ray-Ban AI Smart Glasses, but they're also much more powerful, acting as a complete standalone, wireless VR setup (though you can also plug the headset into your PC or PS5 if you want to play more demanding VR games). If you've been curious about VR gaming but haven't jumped in yet, these bundles are an excellent way to get an affordable VR setup.

For more VR and gaming deals, head over to GameSpot's Black Friday 2025 hub.

item.title: Princess Peach's Castle 738-Piece Lego Mario Playset Is Over 50% Off At Amazon
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Update: This deal is no longer available.

For the second week in a row, Amazon is selling a Lego Super Mario playset for over 50% off during its Black Friday sale. Last week it was Soda Jungle Maker, and this week it's Battle with Roy at Peach's Castle. Normally $65, this 738-piece building set is discounted to only $28. Like Soda Jungle Maker, Peach's Castle is retiring soon, so this is likely your last chance to get a massive discount on the set.

Amazon has already sold out of this deal once today (November 23), but the deal is back in stock as of 5:55 PM PT.

Lego Super Mario: Battle with Roy at Peach's Castle (738 Pieces)

$28 (was $65) | Retiring soon

Battle with Roy at Peach's Castle comes with three buildable Lego Super Mario figures: Roy, Red Toad, and a Chain Chomp that pulls Roy's sled. It doesn't include Peach, who is only available as an interactive figure in the Super Mario Adventures Starter Set, which is on sale for $40 (was $50).

The castle's fold-out walls are destructible, so you can easily refortify your defenses after Chain Chomp crashes into them. Toad can sling projectiles at Roy and Chain Chomp with a built-in catapult atop the castle. If you have Interactive Princess Peach, you can tap the Action Tags on the rotating throne, in the small garden where Toad likes to hang out, and in hidden spots. Tapping an Action Tag plays music and sound effects from the Peach figure's built-in speakers.

item.title: Save $200 On The Lenovo Legion Go S For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Mobile gaming PCs have taken off over the last couple of years, and if you've been holding out for an early Black Friday deal on one, you're in luck. The Lenovo Legion Go S has been heavily discounted, with prices ranging from $450 (was $650) for the Z2 model with a 512GB SSD and the version with the Z1 Extreme chipset, more RAM, and a 1TB SSD is available for $650 (was $900). These powerful portable gaming devices let you play the latest PC games on the go, making them an excellent gift for the hardcore PC gamer in your life. Just make sure you grab these deals soon, as these Best Buy discounts won't last long.

Legion Go S (Z2, 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD)

$450 (was $650)

The Lenovo Legion Go S comes equipped with an 8-inch 120Hz Lenovo PureSight 1200p display and an AMD Ryzen Z2 Go chip with Radeon graphics. This model includes a 512GB SSD, 16GB of RAM, and it runs on Valve's operating system, SteamOS. Storage can be expanded through the microSD slot if 512GB feels too limiting. Games typically run well from a microSD card on SteamOS, and the Z2 chip paired with Radeon graphics can handle a wide range of titles.

The handheld measures 11.75 x 1.71 x 5.02 inches, and it has a 3.5mm audio jack, two USB-C ports, offset thumbsticks, two remappable back triggers, and a small trackpad.

Legion Go S (Z1 Extreme, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD)

$650 (was $900)

The higher-end configuration of the Lenovo Legion Go S uses the older but still powerful AMD Ryzen Z1 Extreme chip with AMD RDNA 3 graphics. It has 32GB of RAM and a larger 1TB SSD, and like the model above, it runs on SteamOS. It features the same screen, inputs, and ergonomic design that has earned praise from critics.

Other handheld gaming PCs, such as the recently released ROG Xbox Ally X, are still selling at their regular MSRP, but Best Buy is offering discounts on the MSI Claw. You can save $180 to $265 on two models: the MSI Claw A1M with a 512GB SSD is down to $390, down from $650, while the 1TB version is $565 (was $750). These units feature 7-inch 1080p screens with a 120Hz refresh rate; 16GB of RAM, Intel Arc Graphics 8X cores, and Intel Core Ultra processors.

Both MSI Claw models run Windows 11, which means you can load games from multiple storefronts, including Steam, GOG, and the Epic Games Store. The trade-off is that Windows can be cumbersome on a handheld PC, but if that does not bother you, you will have far more flexibility when installing and managing games.

MSI Claw A1M Black Friday Deals

  • MSI Claw A1M (512GB SSD, 16GB RAM, Intel Core Ultra 5-135H) -- $390 ($650)
  • MSI Claw A1M (512GB SSD, 16GB RAM, Intel Core Ultra 7-155H) -- $565 ($750)

item.title: HP Went Full Liquidation on 17â€³ Laptop (i5, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD), 71% Off Turns $3K Into Pocket Change
item.content:encoded:
Apple manages impressive 25% discounts on MacBooks through Amazon during Black Friday, but this HP laptop just shattered discount records with a massive 71% price drop.

Amazon dropped this HP laptop to an all-time low of $859 for Black Friday, down from its usual $2,999 price tag. For this price, you get a 13th Gen Intel 10-core i5 processor, 17.3-inch Full HD display, 32GB of RAM, and 1TB SSD storage. Windows 11 Pro comes preloaded with Copilot AI, and HP includes a backlit keyboard plus fingerprint reader for security.

See at Amazon

10-Core Intel Power That Handles Real Work

The 13th Generation Intel Core i5-1334U processor has 10 cores that turbo boost up to 4.6GHz if you need that extra horsepower. The hybrid architecture splits the cores between performance and efficiency, throwing the heavy lifting of demanding tasks to powerful cores while background processes run on efficient cores. You can open multiple Chrome tabs, Microsoft Office applications, video conferencing software, and photo editing programs all at once without any lag.

The 32GB DDR4 RAM removes memory bottlenecks that plague laptops with 8GB or 16GB configurations. You keep dozens of browser tabs open, switch between heavy applications, and work with large datasets without seeing the dreaded spinning wheel. Virtual machines run smoothly for developers or IT professionals who need to test software across different environments.

The 1TB PCIe NVMe SSD provides read speeds to make the entire system snappy and responsive. It boots up Windows in seconds, launches applications almost instantly, and complete file transfers in no time. The storage capacity holds an entire work library of documents, presentations, spreadsheets, photos, videos, and software installations without the constant management of the drive.

The 17.3-inch Full HD display provides serious screen real estate at 1920Ã—1080 resolution. You can view full spreadsheets without horizontal scrolling, edit documents with toolbars visible, and run applications side-by-side comfortably. The anti-glare coating reduces eye strain during marathon work sessions and makes the screen readable in bright offices or near windows.

Fingerprint reader security provides instant login without the need to type passwords every time one opens the laptop. Biometric authentication works quicker and more reliably than passwords, while it offers better security compared with simple PINs. You unlock the laptop with a quick touch of your finger, jumping right into work without delays in authentication. The fingerprint data remains stored locally on the device rather than in cloud databases.

Wi-Fi 6 gives you faster wireless speeds and greater performance in crowded networks than ever before. Fast transfer of bulky files, smooth video streaming, and jitter-free video conferencing are now possible. Bluetooth 5.3 connects your wireless mouse, keyboard, headphones, and other accessories with greater range and reliability. USB Type-A and Type-C ports support existing peripherals and accessories along with newer ones without the need for dongles.

Windows 11 Pro incorporates enterprise features, remote desktop access, and domain joining for business users. Integration with Copilot AI will help users brainstorm ideas, organize tasks, create drafts of content, and answer questions directly in Windows. The AI assistant simplifies your workflow by automating routine tasks for you and displaying relevant suggested actions based on how you work.

This 17.3-inch laptop delivers 10-core Intel performance with 32GB RAM and 1TB SSD for nearly $2,000 off its usual price, at just $859.

item.title: Sonic X Shadow Generations for Switch 2 is 50% off (BF2025)
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Sonic X Shadow Generations launched just over a year ago on Switch, PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC, and recently got an official port to Switch 2 just a few months ago. The game features a remaster of 2011's Sonic Generations alongside the all-new Shadow Generations, offering fans two completely unique games in one package. And now, for Black Friday 2025, the game is discounted to its lowest price ever of just $25 (was $50) on Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo Switch, PS5, and Xbox Series X. You'll also find a bunch of other Sonic games on sale during the event, making this a good time to stock up on titles you may have missed over the past few years.

Sonic X Shadow Generations

$25 (was $50)

Sonic X Shadow Generations offers both 3D and 2D adventures, playing as a greatest-hits roundup for the Blue Blur. For a change of pace, however, you can dive into Shadow Generations, which lets you take control of Shadow as he fights through a brand new adventure. There are plenty of Easter eggs and additional content packed into the bundle--so even once you beat the game, there's always a reason to come back for more. This includes hidden Chao across each level, a chance to play pinball in the Casino Nights zone, and a museum featuring all sorts of behind-the-scenes material.

Sonic X Shadow Generations Deals At Amazon

  • Xbox -- $25 ($50)

Our Sonic X Shadow Generations review called it a "nice enough trip down memory lane," though it does come with some friction due to the age of Sonic Generations. If you're a Sonic fan, you'll probably find something here of value (especially at $25). "Shadow Generations' story is a great opportunity to revisit some of Shadow's most memorable moments as well as past boss battles against other artificial beings that could be considered rivals to the title of "ultimate life form," like the Biolizard from Sonic Adventure 2," wrote critic Jordan RamÃ©e. "I was grinning like a kid again when Shadow faced off against Metal Overlord and Crush 40's "What I'm Made Of..." started playing, reminding me of the hours I lost to Sonic Heroes when I was 10 years old."

Many other Sonic games are on sale for Black Friday, including Sonic Frontiers, which is down to $18 on PS5, $16 on PS4, $10 on Xbox Series X, and $25 on Switch. You can also pick up the Sonic Mania + Team Sonic Racing Double Pack for just $20 (was $40). You'll find a list of even more Sonic game deals below. item.title: Save Up To 70% On Atlus RPGs - Metaphor ReFantazio, Persona, SMT & more
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you're craving a big RPG for the winter months, you're in luck. Several of Atlus and Sega's best RPGs are up to 70% off at Amazon thanks to Black Friday. The deals include Metaphor ReFantazio--the recipient of GameSpot's 2024 Game of the Year pick--which is on sale for for $35 (was $70) for both PS5 and Xbox Series X. While Metaphor ReFantazio's sweeping fantasy story could easily keep you busy for 80 to 100 hours, there are also plenty of other epic RPGs on sale right now, including Persona 3: Reload, Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance Edition, Raidou Remastered, and more. We've rounded up all the Atlus RPG Black Friday deals below--be sure to grab them while you can, because these limited-time discounts could sell out fast. After you've checked those out, head over to GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub to see all the best holiday price cuts on video games, PC hardware, collectible figures, and more.

Metaphor ReFantazio

$35 (was $70)

Metaphor ReFantazio shares several elements with other JRPGS from Atlus, but it also streamlines the experience and keeps players invested with enticing gameplay and a roster of lovable characters. While it's an engaging game to play, Metaphor ReFantazio shines brightest when its narrative steps into the spotlight, as the game features a story honed to a razor's edge by Atlus subsidiary Studio Zero. It's a story about stories, cleverly woven into the fabric of the game and bolstered by rich lore, in-depth worldbuilding, and an art direction that makes the fantasy of Metaphor ReFantazio look unique.

The game received a rare 10/10 in GameSpot's review and it was also named our 2024 Game of the Year.

Metaphor ReFantazio deals at Amazon

  • PS5 -- $35 ($70)
  • Xbox Series X -- $35 ($70)

Persona 3: Reload

Starts at $18

A remake of 2006's Persona 3, Persona 3 Reload keeps the game's core story intact and elevates it with brand-new gameplay and visuals. Still faithful to the original, Persona 3 Reload makes an already great game even better with its enhancements. Amazon's pricing differs between consoles--PS5 owners can get the game for just $18, while the PS4 version is $20, the Xbox Series X version is $25, and the Switch 2 version is $40 (was $60). Note that the Switch 2 version is a game key-card release, meaning you have to download the digital version to your console (around 25.3GB file size) before you can play.

Persona 3: Reload deals at Amazon

  • PS5 -- $18 ($70)
  • PS4 -- $20 ($70)
  • Xbox Series X -- $25 ($70)
  • Switch 2 (Game Key-Card) -- $40 ($60)

Persona 5 Royal (Switch)

$25 (was $60)

Atlus had earned a loyal following over the years with its Persona games, but Persona 5 is arguably the game that put the company on radar of JRPG fans looking for something different. The anime art style, rich character relationships, and an overarching story that will take dozens of hours to complete made it a big hit, and the Royal Edition of the game fleshes out those aspects of the game even further with quality-of-life tweaks and more content.

Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army

$30 (was $50)

Another blast from the past, Raidou Remastered is a remake of a 2006 PS2 game from the Shin Megami Tensei series. Part of the Devil Summoner subseries, the action-RPG features revamped visuals and audio, combat enhancements, brand voice acting, expanded 3D environments, and a slick user interface. Set in 1930s Tokyo, players embark on a supernatural adventure, collecting dozens of demons to aid them in their quest to prevent humanity from being consumed by darkness.

As with other Atlus games released on Switch 2, Raidou Remastered's physical Switch 2 edition is a game key-card that grants access to the digital version of the game, rather than storing the game data on the cart. The game requires just under 12GB.

Raidou Remastered deals at Amazon

  • PS5 -- $30 ($50)
  • Xbox Series X -- $40 ($50)
  • Switch -- $30 ($50)
  • Switch 2 (Game Key-Card) -- $30 ($50)

Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance

$18 (was $60)

Originally exclusive to Nintendo Switch, Shin Megami Tensei eventually came to other consoles as part of an upgraded release, dubbed the Vengeance. This version of Shin Megami Tensei V addressed many of the original game's shortcomings, fine-tuning the combat and exploration while adding updated visuals and new story content. Set in a version of Tokyo destroyed by a demonic invasion, players harness this dark power on their journey as they amass an army of loyal demons.

Note that Amazon's discount only appears to apply to the PS5 and Nintendo Switch versions of the game, both of which are cut to just $18 (normally $60). That's a massive 70% discount. The Xbox Series X edition is also available, but is currently priced at $45.

Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance deals at Amazon

item.title: Roborock Qrevo CurvX Drops to All-Time Low, 22,000Pa Beast With Auto Hot Water Cleaning Falls to Record Pricing
item.content:encoded:
Roborock holds the same premium position in robot vacuums that Dyson commands in traditional vacuums, with flagship models regularly exceeding $1,500 to $2,000. These luxury cleaning machines pack technology that separates them from budget competitors flooding the market.

The good news is that Amazon just dropped one of Roborockâ€™s best-sellers to an all-time low of $849 for Black Friday, nearly half off from its usual $1,499 price tag. The Qrevo CurvX delivers 22,000Pa suction, zero-tangling design, reactive AI obstacle recognition and 80Â°C hot water mop washing.

See at Amazon

Technology That Solves Real Cleaning Problems

The 22,000Pa HyperForce suction creates enough force to pull deeply embedded dirt from carpet pile and pulls debris from gaps in hardwood flooring. You can immediately tell the difference compared with a vacuum that has only 8,000-10,000Pa-suction power and tends to push dust instead of picking it up. Pet hair, long human hair up to 40cm, cereal crumbs, and tracked-in dirt-all get pulled into the dustbin in one pass. The zero-tangling design stops hair from tangling around the brushes, thus doing away with the maintenance nightmare of standard robot vacuums where you end up spending 15 minutes each week cutting tangled hair off rollers.

The ultra-slim profile, at only 3.14 inches, makes this the thinnest Roborock ever manufactured-just 7.98cm tall. This reduced height lets the robot glide under sofas, beds, and cabinets where dust bunnies really collect. Traditional robot vacuums with raised LiDAR domes get stuck or completely skip whole sections below furniture. This Roborock reaches those forgotten spaces and captures hidden dirt that ruins air quality even when visible floors appear clean.

Reactive AI obstacle recognition relies on structured light and an RGB camera to detect and avoid 108 different object types. It works both in bright and dark environments and navigates around toys, cables, pet bowls, shoes, and even furniture legs without getting stuck. You donâ€™t have to preclean your floors before running the vacuum, which really changes the vacuum from a scheduled maintenance tool into something you can turn on spontaneously.

AdaptiLift Chassis is industry-first technology that can lift the entire robot up to 4cm or individually according to terrain. The system raises the front to climb high thresholds, adjusts side wheels to navigate around furniture legs, and lowers for tight clearances. This adaptability prevents the â€˜stuckâ€™ notifications which interrupt other robot vacuums in mid-clean.

The 80Â°C hot water washing of the mop dissolves stubborn stains and grease left by cold water. The dock heats water to 176Â°F before washing the mop pads to make sure they are thoroughly cleaned and sanitized after each use. Warm air drying at 113Â°F prevents mildew and odors from forming on damp mop pads. This focus on hygiene means your robot will never spread dirty water around on your floors in the course of subsequent cleaning.

The automated maintenance tasks handled by the Multifunctional Dock 3.0 Thermo+ mean you barely touch the robot. Auto dust emptying transfers collected debris to the dockâ€™s larger bag, holding weeks of dirt. Auto tank refilling keeps the water reservoir full for mopping sessions. Intelligent dirt detection analyzes mop pad contamination and adjusts washing intensity accordingly. The dock performs self-cleaning with hot water, preventing the buildup that makes other docking stations smell terrible after a few weeks.

At $849, this Roborock delivers flagship cleaning technology and hot water mop washing for $650 off the usual price. You are getting premium features that normally would call for an outlay in excess of $1,500+, skimping on very few minor conveniences.

See at Amazon

item.title: Mario & Sonic At The Olympic Games 2020 Is 50% Off
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The 2026 Winter Olympics take place next February in Milano and Cortina, Italy, but you can get a head start with your own virtual Olympics thanks to a Black Friday deal dropping Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 for Nintendo Switch down to $30 (was $60). That's just barely above its all-time low price of $29.53. While Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 is focused on Summer Olympic sports, Amazon's 50% discount is a great way to get in the Olympic spirit a few months before the winter event kicks off.

Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020

$30 (was $60)

Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 features 34 events, a variety of minigames, and both single-player and multiplayer modes. You'll find all the Summer Olympic staples here, taking you from the track to the swimming pool and boxing ring to the archery range. Each event ranges in complexity--most feature easy-to-learn controls, while others, like soccer and rugby, offer more depth and challenge, making this a great minigame collection for players of all skill levels. The roster of playable characters includes familiar faces from both the Sonic and Mario series, including the titular mascots themselves, and friends like Luigi, Tails, Waluigi, Dr. Eggman, and more.

Our Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 review gave it a 7/10, due to its entertaining events (each with its own gimmick) and unique control schemes that make it easy to find a playstyle that works for just about everyone.

"Mario & Sonic at the Tokyo Olympic Games 2020 is an entertaining take on the sports-event genre that has, by and large, disappeared in the modern-day," wrote critic James O'Connor. "The game aims for accessibility at every opportunity, and while nothing about it is particularly exceptional, it still has plenty of unique flourishes to offer, and the wealth of different events and simple controls make for an appealing casual multiplayer title. Thanks to a generous selection of events and a few neat gimmicks, Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 is the best entry in this series."

item.title: Anker Solix Makes EcoFlow and Jackery Look Overpriced, 2,000W Power Station Selling for Pocket Change
item.content:encoded:
While EcoFlow, Anker and Jackery were all fairly aggressive in their Black Friday pricing on Amazon, only Anker provides 2,000W output at $349. Competitor power stations in the $350-$400 price range top out at 1,500-1,800W which gets you less power for similar money.

Amazon has just dropped the Anker SOLIX C1000 (second gen) to an all-time low of $349, down from its usual $449 price tag. You get 2,000W continuous output with 3,000W surge capacity, a 1,024Wh LiFePO4 battery lasting 10 years and it can recharge fully in just 49 minutes.

See at Amazon

2,000W Output Powers What You Need

The 2,000W continuous output handles high-draw appliances that kill weaker power stations instantly. You can power up space heaters, window air conditioners, power tools, electric kettles, and other demanding devices without triggering overload shutdowns. The 3,000W surge capacity absorbs the startup power spikes that motors and compressors create when they first kick on. Refrigerators, well pumps, and air compressors all draw massive current for a few seconds during startup, and this power station handles those surges without flinching.

Ten output ports spread the power across various devices at once, without having to prioritize what charges first. The port selection includes AC outlets for the standard household devices, USB-C with fast charging for phones and laptops, USB-A for the older gear and a car outlet for the 12V accessories. You can power a full remote work setup with laptop, monitor, router, and phone charger while running a mini fridge and fan during power outages.

The 49-minute recharge time using HyperFlash technology at 1,600W input redefines how you use portable power stations. The traditional models take 6-10 hours to recharge from empty, creating overnight charging rituals which make the power station unavailable when you need it. This Anker charges over a lunch break or during a quick stop at an RV park and is ready for another full day of heavy use. You enable HyperFlash mode through the Anker app when you need maximum charging speed, or use standard charging for quieter operation.

LiFePO4 battery chemistry offers 10 years of reliable performance with 4,000 charge cycles before capacity drops to 80%. Traditional lithium-ion batteries degrade much faster; many lose a large portion of their capacity after 500-1,000 cycles. The longevity transforms this from a disposable gadget into a legitimate long-term investment that keeps working through years of regular use. The battery is much safer while charging and discharging than a standard lithium battery due to a lower risk of fire and higher thermal stability.

UPS functionality with under 10-millisecond switchover keeps sensitive equipment running during power transitions. CPAP machines, computers, modems, and medical devices never experience interruption when grid power fails. The power station detects outages and seamlessly takes over power delivery before the connected devices even notice anything happened.

At 14% smaller and 11% lighter than other 1,000Wh class products on the market, this compact unit makes transport and storage easier. You can also move it between rooms, load it into vehicles for camping, or stash it in closets without excessive effort.

This $349, 2,000W power station offers more output capacity and 49-minute recharging, while its usual price is $100 lower than the normal. Other competitors charge similar prices for less powerful 1,500-1,800W models with slower charging.

item.title: Sonos Offloads Era 300 at Zero Margin, Dolby Atmos Rival to Devialet Hits Pocket Change Pricing
item.content:encoded:
Sonos made its name with speakers that promise high-quality sound without the complexity of a traditional hi-fi system. The Era 300 is its most ambitious speaker yet, using spatial audio technology to create sound that moves around you rather than just blasting from one direction.

Amazon just dropped it to an all-time low of $379 for Black Friday, down from its usual $479 price tag. You get six strategically positioned drivers that support Dolby Atmos Music and create wall-to-wall and floor-to-ceiling sound projection.

See at Amazon

Six Drivers That Create Dimensional Sound

Placement of Era 300 drivers on the front, sides and top projects sound in multiple directions at once. This configuration serves as the sonic environment Dolby Atmos content needs to operate. Instruments and vocals are placed in locations around your listening space. You hear guitar riffs coming from your left, vocals centered in front, and ambient effects floating overhead.

Custom waveguides tailor the sound dispersion of each driver to make sure you get audio coming from the correct right, left, forward, and above positions. The waveguides serve as acoustic lenses, focusing sound with directional control. You get a wide stereo soundstage that immerses the whole room, instead of a narrow sweet spot where everything sounds good. You can walk around the room without killing the effect, unlike what happens with traditional stereo speakers that only sound right when youâ€™re seated perfectly centered.

Dolby Atmos Music leverages these spatial capabilities when you stream compatible content from services like Apple Music and Amazon Music. Artists and producers mix Atmos tracks with height and surround channels, placing different elements in a three-dimensional sound field. Listening to Atmos mixes reveals details and separations you never noticed in stereo versions. Drum fills circle around you, backup vocals float distinct from lead vocals, and instrumental layers occupy their own space rather than competing for attention.

Wi-Fi streaming provides stable, high-quality audio from all major music services, including Spotify, Apple Music, Amazon Music, Tidal, and dozens more. The Sonos app controls everything: You can browse catalogs, create queues, and manage multiple speakers throughout your home. Bluetooth pairing adds flexibility for devices or services that work better with direct connections. The Sonos Line-In Adapter lets you connect turntables or other audio sources, bringing analog gear into your wireless system.

Regular software updates mean that features and integrations are added over time and keep the speaker current as the streaming landscape evolves. Sonos has a great track record of supporting older products with updates years after youâ€™ve bought them. Updates happen automatically in the background without any need for manual intervention or compatibility concerns.

The speaker works as a standalone device or incorporates with bigger Sonos systems across several rooms. You can group speakers together for synchronized music playback throughout your home or control each independently to have different audio in every space. The system scales from a single speaker up to whole-home audio, with no complicated wiring or technical expertise.

At $379, this spatial audio speaker delivers Dolby Atmos Music and multi-directional sound for $100 off its usual price. Youâ€™re getting Sonos build quality and future software support at a price that makes experimenting with spatial audio reasonable.

See at Amazon

item.title: Anker Selling 30W Power Bank for Pocket Change, 10,000mAh Battery Pack Now Costs Almost Free
item.content:encoded:
Cheap power banks die after a few months or charge so slowly youâ€™re still stuck glued to walls for several hours. The Anker Zolo power bank provides legitimate 30W fast charging to rival wall outlets, yet still brings the same durability Anker has built a name on. Amazon just dropped it to an all-time low of $19 for Black Friday, down from the usual $25.

You get here 10,000mAh capacity good for two full iPhone charges, a baked-in USB-C cable tested for 10,000 bends and bidirectional charging that tops up the power bank itself in reasonable time.

See at Amazon

30W Charging That Matches Your Wall Charger

The output of 30W gives double the charging speed of the conventional power banks-5V/3A-that crawl at 15W. Your iPhone 16 Pro Max hits 50% in just 27 minutes, matching what youâ€™d get from plugging into a wall outlet with Appleâ€™s fast charger. Conventional power banks take more than an hour to reach the same charge level, which makes using them an exercise in frustration for a quick top-up between meetings or during short breaks.

The 10,000mAh capacity will yield nearly two full charges for an iPhone 17, 1.94 charges for a Samsung Galaxy S25, and two full charges for an iPhone 14 Pro before recharging the power bank. You should be able to make it through long days of traveling, outdoor activities, or power outages without feeling anxious that your phone is going to die on you. The capacity also delivers about 10 full charges for the AirPods Pro 3 and keeps your earbuds powered for weeks of commutes.

Eliminate the frustration of forgetting charging cables at home or digging through bags to find them with the 5.4-inch-long built-in USB-C cable. Itâ€™s attached to the power bank and is ready whenever you need it. Anker tested this cable through 10,000 bend cycles and they ensure the cable survives wrapping, twisting, or stuffing into a pocket thousands of times.

Bidirectional 30W charging means the power bank recharges quickly through the same USB-C port it uses to charge your devices. The 20W input fills the battery much faster than older power banks that take six hours to recharge from empty. You can top up the power bank during lunch breaks or short charging windows rather than leaving it plugged in overnight. The convenience of fast recharging makes the power bank practical for daily use rather than something you charge once weekly.

The compact 4.32 x 2.58 x 0.98-inch dimensions slip easily into pockets, purses, or laptop bags without creating noticeable bulk. The power bank weighs less than your phone, making it comfortable to carry on any commute or travel.

Additional USB-C and USB-A ports allow you to charge multiple devices at the same time using your own cables. The USB-A port remains compatible with older devices and accessories that havenâ€™t transitioned over to USB-C. You can also charge your phone via the built-in cable while powering earbuds or a smartwatch through the extra ports. This multi-device capability proves useful when traveling with a lot of gadgets.

Anker backs the power bank with an 18-month warranty to cover defects and performance issues. The companyâ€™s customer service responds rapidly to problems, normally replacing faulty units with minimal hassle. This value-added support comes into play well beyond the price paid, since you are covered when problems crop up.

At $19, this 10,000mAh power bank offers 30W fast charging with a rugged built-in cable for well below the competition, which usually carries worse specs at higher prices.

item.title: The 10 Most Valuable Avatar: The Last Airbender Magic Cards That I'm Already Chasing
item.content:encoded:
Cracking packs for Magic: The Gatheringâ€™s latest Universes Beyond set, Avatar: The Last Airbender?

Us two, and with the new set finally back in stock online, it looks as though it might be a set you can more readily buy.

So, what are the chase cards? What are the most powerful characters, and which are the rarest? Weâ€™ve broken down the top 10 most valuable cards using data from the folks at TCGPlayer.

Before we begin, however, itâ€™s worth remembering that we are talking close to launch prices here, and weâ€™ve taken them as close to the setâ€™s launch date to try and keep things as accurate as possible.

10 - Ozai, the Phoenix King (Borderless) - $20

Magic: The Gathering Ozai, the Phoenix King (Borderless)

This Ozai, the Phoenix King (Borderless) variant has striking artwork, the firebending keyword, and a high mana cost - but can be indestructible if you have enough unspent mana.

9 - Appa, Steadfast Guardian (Borderless) - $22

Magic: The Gathering Appa, Steadfast Guardian (Borderless)

Aangâ€™s faithful companion is not only adorable, but he has airbending potential on the battlefield, too. This borderless version is up to $22 at the time of writing. Yip yip!

8 - Fire Lord Azula (Borderless) - $28

Magic: The Gathering Fire Lord Azula (Borderless)

Fire Lord Azula can firebend 2, and can double your spells while attacking, while being a 4/4 in its own right. Itâ€™s up to around $30 for this awesome borderless variant.

7 - Avatar Aang (Borderless) - $35

Magic: The Gathering Avatar Aang (Borderless)

Sitting at $35, Avatar Aang is a transforming card that switches to Aang, Master of Elements if you bend all four elements in a single turn. The colorless artwork looks really great on both sides of this borderless option.

6 - Badgermole Cub - $50

Magic: The Gathering Badgermole Cub

It may seem a strange card to climb in value, but Badgermole Cub now only earthbends 1, but it can also add additional mana when youâ€™re tapping creatures. That means even the standard version is valued at $50 - and itâ€™s climbing.

5 - Wan Shi Tong, Librarian - $54

Magic: The Gathering Wan Shi Tong, Librarian

Wan Shi Tong, Librarian can rack up counters, has Flash, Flying, and Vigilance, and gives you card draw, too. Whatâ€™s not to love? This standard version is up to $54.

4 - Ozai, the Phoenix King (Borderless) - $55

Magic: The Gathering Ozai, the Phoenix King (Borderless)

Another printing of Ozai, this version has an inky-black background but performs the same as the other Borderless version on this list.

3 - Badgermole Cub (Borderless) - $60

Magic: The Gathering Badgermole Cub (Borderless)

Functionally identical to the Badgermole Cub above, this one has a borderless design and is $60 or $94 in foil right now.

2 - Wan Shi Tong, Librarian (Borderless) - $

Magic: The Gathering Wan Shi Tong, Librarian (Borderless)

The same card as number 5 on this list, this borderless variant looks even betterbut will set you back around $90

1 - Neon Ink Foil Cards - $2,000 and up

If you crack open a pack and find a Neon Ink Foil version of Aang, Swift Savior, Fire Lord Zuko, Katara, the Fearless, or Toph, the First Metalbender, theyâ€™re going for $2,000 and up right now - good luck!

Where to Find These Rare Cards

Magic's Avatar: The Last Airbender Collector Booster Box is finally back in stock and available to buy at Amazon, priced at $455.88. This is the best way to hunt down the rarest Avatar x MTG cards, if you got the cash to flash.

This is much cheaper compared to the market price, as seen at TCGplayer, which has it listed at around $528. These collector boosters have been incredibly hard to come by, hence the high pricing.

Magic: The Gathering | Avatar: The Last Airbender Collector Booster Box

But, if you play your cards right, there are also a couple of amazing promo offers that could bag you this crazy expensive booster box for under $250. If you fancy saving a small fortune, you'll need to check if you're eligible for an Amazon Visa card (see here).

After signing up, you'll receive an instant $60 gift card credited to your Amazon account. This will bring down the total price to $489.99, which is well below market value.

TCGPlayer's Black Friday Sale Starts November 28

One more thing before you go, Trading card game players rejoice; TCGPlayer is having a nice Black Friday promotion. From November 28 at 9 AM ET to December 1 at 11 PM ET, you can get 10% cash back in store credits on all purchases.

This includes both single cards and sealed products. Plus, if you're a TCGPlayer subscriber, you'll get 13% or more back (12% base plus 1-3% monthly loyalty bonus). That's pretty great, all things considered.

If you're looking to buy any singles, it's worth holding off until then to get the best deal possible.

item.title: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond Demo Now Available At Switch 2 Kiosks (US)
item.content:encoded:
Samus returns this December

Nintendo has been promoting the Switch 2 in stores with kiosks, where you can go and play the latest and upcoming titles.

We've already seen games such as Donkey Kong Bananza added to these store units, and now, in a very exciting update, it seems Metroid Prime 4: Beyond - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition is playable at select locations in the US.

This demo has been spotted at Walmart and other stores, and apparently has a time limit of 20 minutes.

'SBelmont' via r/NintendoSwitch: "I played it myself once already. It's has a 20 minute time limit but I reached the "end" around 13 minutes in. It's a small portion of the prologue that takes place at a Federation base being attacked by Space Pirates before going to the new planet. Apparently it's the same demo that they had at Gamescom."

So, if you happen to be located in the US and have a store nearby with one of these Switch 2 kiosks, you may want to head over and check it out. Nintendo hasn't announced an eShop demo for this title, so a store visit is currently the only way to get a sample of the action right now.

Metroid Prime 4: Beyond for Switch 2 and Switch arrives next month on 4th December 2025. Have you tested out this anticipated release at a kiosk or event yet? Let us know in the comments.

[source gonintendo.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: Mac Mini Has a Budget Twin Now, 512GB Mini PC Selling for Pennies That Makes Apple Look Greedy
item.content:encoded:
Mini PCs solve the desktop dilemma where full-sized towers waste space and energy while delivering more power than most people actually need. The Kamrui GK3Plus puts a complete Windows computer inside a 5.1-inch cube that fits behind monitors or tucks into entertainment centers.

Amazon just dropped it to $189, and with the exclusive Prime promotion code 47DA9QPV66FE, you save an additional 10% off that price to bring the final cost down to $170 instead of the usual $229. For this price, you get a 12th Gen Intel N95 processor, 16GB of RAM, 512GB SSD storage, and triple-display support with 4K output.

See at Amazon

Delivers Real Performance

The Alder Lake N95 processor runs at a base frequency of 1.7GHz, and turboes up to 3.4GHz when needed. This will smoothly handle everyday computing tasks. The quad-core chip with 6MB L3 cache outperforms the older N5105 and N5095 processors by about 35% in CPU tasks and about 78% in GPU performance. You can just go ahead and browse dozens of browser tabs, edit documents, manage spreadsheets, and stream video without any slowdowns.

The 16GB DDR4 RAM keeps multiple applications running simultaneously without forcing your computer to swap data to slower storage. You can have Chrome open with 30 tabs running, Microsoft Office applications running in the background, stream music and have video calls going on with no memory bottlenecks. The generous RAM capacity future-proofs the system as software continues demanding more memory.

The 512GB M.2 SSD offers fast boot time and application loading and makes the entire system seem responsive. Windows boots in seconds, applications launch almost instantly, and file transfers are quick. The SSD includes ample room for operating system, applications, and personal files without the need for constant storage management.

Triple-display support via two HDMI and one VGA port lets you connect three monitors simultaneously for massive workspace. The HDMI outputs support 4K at 60Hz, which means text and color on modern displays come out sharp. You can dedicate one screen to email and messaging, another to your main work, and a third to reference materials or monitoring dashboards. The VGA port keeps compatibility with older monitors and projectors that havenâ€™t transitioned to HDMI.

VESA mounting brackets let you attach the mini PC directly to the back of your monitor, creating an all-in-one computer setup that saves desk space. The compact 5.1 x 5.1 x 1.96-inch dimensions disappear behind displays, keeping your workspace clean and cable management simple. This small form factor fits perfectly in crowded workstations, home theaters behind TVs, digital signage installations, or anywhere space is limited.

Gigabit Ethernet provides stable wired network connections for consistent speeds and low latency. Dual-band Wi-Fi features both 2.4GHz and 5GHz networks for wireless flexibility where Ethernet isnâ€™t practical. Bluetooth 4.2 connects wireless keyboards, mice, speakers, and headphones without dongle clutter. Several USB ports handle peripherals, external drives and accessories simultaneously.

The cooling fan keeps the processor at optimal temperatures during sustained workloads and cools quietly during normal operation, only spinning up when performing more computationally intensive tasks. The cooling system keeps thermal throttling at bay, which would slow performance with jobs such as video encoding, code compilation, or running multiple demanding applications.

At $170 after stacking discounts, this mini PC offers modern Intel performance, 16GB of RAM, and triple 4K display support for a lot less than budget laptops with far worse specifications. Youâ€™re getting a complete desktop replacement that handles work, entertainment, and even creativity without the bulk or cost of traditional towers.

item.title: FaZe Clan Fans Arenâ€™t Happy With New Rollbit Jersey
item.content:encoded:
Earlier today, FaZe Clan unveiled its 2026 esports jersey, and fans were immediately displeased by the excessive â€˜Rollbitâ€™ branding that was slapped on the front and shoulder of it. In recent weeks, the heavy marketing push that Rollbit has been making into streaming and content creation has left fans and viewers dismayed at some, but no matter what, the bags keep flowing.

The jersey would look fantastic, some argue, if the sponsorship branding were either toned back or removed entirely, but thatâ€™s not going to happen.

FaZe Clanâ€™s New Rollbit Jersey Sparks Outcry

On social media, FaZe Clan uncovered the jersey that the pro teams under the banner will be sporting for the next year of competition. Fans were quick to point out that once prestigious sponsorships like Nissan and G-Fuel have long been removed, and in their place sits a glaring ROLLBIT sponsorship.

The jersey, which is a nice black and red digital camo design, has come under intense criticism by fans, commenting that the FaZe logo is â€˜smaller than the Rollbit brandingâ€™.

Rollbit has been the cause of some inflammation across the esports and streaming industries of late, offering immense bags to high-ranking streamers to host gambling streams, some of which have thrown entire fanbases into question. Now, that influence is being felt in esports via sponsorships like this.

In one comment, a user wrote a damning review:

With the gambling sponsor being larger than the team logo and in several places I highly doubt many will sell. Glad I got mine a few years ago when it looked like a team jersey (with) a few sponsors.

Another wrote, â€˜I thought this was FaZe, not Team Rollbit.â€™

Other fans were less critical and stressed that the jersey is â€˜fireâ€™, while some tried to field some suggestions:

Idk how i feel bout that big rollbit logo in the middle of it if you left that off and just kept it with the red and black design continuing on the front itâ€™d be clean

What do you think about the new FaZe Clan jersey? Let the world know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: ARC Raiders â€“ Everything We Know About The Latest Hot Extraction Shooter
item.content:encoded:
Following the mixed reception to its debut title, the free-to-play arena shooter game The Finals, Embark Studios returns stronger than ever with ARC Raiders, a PvPvE third-person extraction shooter title. Here's an overview of everything we know about this game.

Release Date, Platforms, Pricing, Editions

ARC Raiders was actually announced before The Finals, during The Game Awards 2021. Back then, Embark conceived it as a free-to-play cooperative (PvE) third-person shooter game, but it was eventually reworked to be a buy-to-play PvPvE game. This, of course, meant a delay over the original plan.

At Summer Game Fest 2025, Embark finally announced the final launch date: October 30, 2025. The game is available in two purchase options. The Standard Edition is priced at $39.99. For those seeking extras, a Deluxe Edition is offered at $59.99. This version of the game provides 2,400 Raider Tokens (used as in-game currency) as well as "The Wanderer" Pack, which includes the Valente Outfit, Pathfinder Backpack, and Blanket Roll. Inside the game, there are paid options for cosmetic-only purchases and battle pass-style content via Raider Tokens.

Genre, Setting, and Story Premise

As mentioned briefly earlier, the final version of ARC Raiders is a third-person PvPvE extraction shooter. The game takes place in a post-apocalyptic Earth, with the devastated landscape specifically centered on the Italian coast. Humanity has been forced to retreat underground after a catastrophic event: an invasion by ARC units, mysterious mechanical enemies that descended from orbit in overwhelming numbers. The few survivors now huddle in the subterranean city of Toledo in the District of Speranza and surface only when necessary to scavenge and survive among the ruins above.

Arguably, what really sets ARC Raiders apart visually is its retro-futuristic vision, blending Cold War analog tech with advanced robotics and rich atmospheric detail. The world is streaked with neon, battered by fog and synth-heavy soundscapes, and every corner tells a story of a society that once was.

Just like most extraction shooters, ARC Raiders does not feature a traditional story campaign. The game does, however, include narrative bits that the players can discover through environmental clues, NPC interactions, and evolving background quests. Players are "Raiders," those few resourceful survivors that risk the dangers of the topside in search of loot (mechanically) and answers, such as what happened with the ARC invasion and the fate of Earth's vanished elite.

Gameplay

The core gameplay experience of ARC Raiders revolves around raiding, scavenging, and ultimately extracting. Each expedition on the surface is a tense, half-hour race against time, as players band together in squads of three or two players (although it is also possible to queue solo) to delve into dangerous zones, whose environments range from crumbling cities and derelict bunkers to the rusting debris of fallen spacecraft.

Players must carefully navigate the post-apocalyptic maps, being wary of both the hostile ARC robots and other human players who are also hunting the same vital resources. Tactics, aim, and squad coordination are essential, not least because at any moment a failed fight can mean the loss of everything not safely stored. The gameâ€™s extraction mechanic adds another strategic layer, requiring Raiders to find and reach specific extraction points before timeâ€”or luckâ€”runs out. Extraction can be accomplished via elevators, metro stations, or secure hatches that require special keys and offer safer withdrawal, but each method presents its own risk and reward trade-offs.

The constant tension of loss and reward is what drives progression. Upon a successful extraction, teams return with valuable materials and equipment, which can be used to upgrade gear and base facilities for future runs. Anything not successfully extracted is, however, forfeit. Collaboration is therefore both supported and encouraged, as squads must rely on careful coordination to contend with unpredictable PvP encounters and environmental hazards, ranging from dynamic enemy spawns to changing weather and toxic zones. Notably, the game features a "Match Journey" system, which chronicles the story of each run.

Tech and Specs

ARC Raiders utilizes Unreal Engine 5 to deliver its sophisticated visuals. The PC version supports NVIDIA's RTX Global Illumination, DLSS Super Resolution, DLSS Frame Generation, DLSS Multi Frame Generation, and Reflex. The game also supports AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution 3.1, Intel XeSS 1.3, TAAU, TSR, and AMD FSR Frame Generation.

You can find the official system requirements below.

Minimum:

  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit or later (latest update)
  • CPU: Intel Core i5-6600K or AMD Ryzen R5 1600
  • RAM: 12 GB
  • GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti, AMD Radeon RX 580, or Intel Arc A380
  • VRAM: 4 GB
  • Shader Model: 6.0
  • Storage: 100 GB (SSD or HDD)

Recommended:

  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit or later (latest update)
  • CPU: Intel Core i5-9600K or AMD Ryzen 5 3600
  • RAM: 16 GB
  • GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2070 or AMD Radeon RX 5700 XT or Intel Arc B570
  • VRAM: 8 GB
  • Shader Model: 6.0

ARC Raiders lack native support for HDR (High Dynamic Range) displays.

item.title: The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom Is Only $30 This Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
The best Legend of Zelda deal so far.

With the new screenshots for the Zelda movie released, many new Zelda fans are looking to explore the series for the first time. The best time of the year to score Zelda games on sale is here with Black Friday, and the latest 2D entry, The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, is available for 50% off for a limited time. Grab the trusty Tri Rod and begin an exciting adventure across Hyrule today!

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom for Only $30

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom - Nintendo Switch

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom is one of the most unique games in the franchise for many reasons, but none are more obvious than this being the first game with Zelda as the protagonist. Instead of playing as Link, you play as Princess Zelda, who must save Hyrule on her own. As a result of this design, the game plays vastly differently from any other in the series.

The star of the gameplay is Zelda's Tri Rod, allowing you to create Echoes of almost anything. This can mean copying a bed and placing a dozen to form a staircase, or even spawning enemies to attack for you. You can get very creative with how you solve each puzzle, as most of the time, there is never just one solution. Creativity is key, and it's up to you to determine how to approach new challenges.

If you're a fan of Zelda games and have yet to check out Echoes of Wisdom, Black Friday is the perfect time to do so. This is especially true for Nintendo Switch 2 owners who skipped out on Switch, as there is an update for enhanced performance that supports 4K resolution and 60 frames per second.

For more Black Friday deals, be sure to check out the full Nintendo Black Friday sale to save on even more Nintendo Switch games. If you're looking for deals outside of games, the Amazon Black Friday sale is a great place to start.

More Nintendo Swich Games on sale today

Noah Hunter is a freelance writer and reviewer with a passion for games and technology. He co-founded Final Weapon, an outlet focused on nonsense-free Japanese gaming (in 2019) and has contributed to various publishers writing about the medium.
